description.p: Barbarians who follow the Path of the Wild Heart view themselves as kin to animals. These Barbarians learn magical means to communicate with animals, and their Rage heightens their connection to animals as it fills them with supernatural might.

sheet.description: Those who commune with the nature the most.

description.p: You can cast the Beast Sense and Speak with Animals spells but only as Rituals. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them.

sheet.description: You can cast the Beast Sense and Speak with Animals spells but only as Rituals. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for them.

description.p: Your Rage taps into the primal power of animals. Whenever you activate your Rage, you gain one of the following options of your choice.
Bear: While your Rage is active, you have Resistance to every damage type except Force, Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant.
Eagle: When you activate your Rage, you can take the Disengage and Dash actions as part of that Bonus Action. While your Rage is active, you can take a Bonus Action to take both of those actions.
Wolf:While your Rage is active, your allies have Advantage on attack rolls against any enemy of yours within 5 feet of you.

sheet.description: When you enter in Rage, choose one of the following additional effects: Bear: while your Rage is active, you have Resistance to every damage type except Force, Necrotic, Psychic, and Radiant. Eagle: when you activate your Rage, you can take the Disengage and Dash actions as part of that Bonus Action. While your Rage is active, you can take a Bonus Action to take both of those actions. Wolf: while your Rage is active, your allies have Advantage on attack rolls against any enemy of yours within 5 feet of you.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you gain one of the following options of your choice. Whenever you finish a Long Rest, you can change your choice.
Owl: you have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet. If you already have Darkvision, its range increases by 60 feet.
Panther: you have a Climb Speed equal to your Speed.
Salmon: you have a Swim Speed equal to your Speed.

sheet.description: When you finish a Long Rest, choose one of the following option: Owl: you have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet. If you already have Darkvision, its range increases by 60 feet. description.p: At 10th level, you can cast the Commune with Nature spell but only as a Ritual. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

sheet.description: You can cast the Commune with Nature spell but only as a Ritual. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for it.

description.p: At 14th level, Whenever you activate your Rage, you gain one of the following options of your choice.
Falcon: while your Rage is active, you have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed if you aren't wearing any armor.
Lion: while your Rage is active, any of your enemies within 5 feet of you have Disadvantage on attack rolls against targets other than you or another Barbarian who has this option active.
Ram: while your Rage is active, you can cause a Large or smaller creature to have the Prone condition when you hit it with a melee attack.
